title: Introduction to swfscAirDAS
text: addition, can chop effort data segments, summarize conditions sightings segments using airdas_effort airdas_effort_sight. effort segments can used line transect estimates using Distance software, species distribution modeling, summarizing number harbor porpoises transect, among uses. airdas_effort chops continuous effort sections (event sequence T/R E/O events) effort segments using one several different chopping methods: condition (new effort segment every time condition changes), equal length (effort segments equal length), section (segment full continuous effort section, .e. runs T/R event E/O event). airdas_effort_sight takes output airdas_effort returns number sightings animals per segment specified species codes. functions return list three data frames: segdata, sightinfo, randpicks. Briefly, data frames different chopping methodologies described depth function documentation (?airdas_effort ?airdas_effort_sight), segdata contains information effort segment, sightinfo contains information sightings segments, randpicks contains information specific ‘equal length’ chopping method. separate functions allow user control filters applied determine sightings included summaries (see ?airdas_effort). wanted determine number humpback whales transect sighting angle -60 60 degrees, instance, following example also simply group transect column, structure robust analyzing multi-year data sets transects flown multiple times.

title: Introduction to swfscAirDAS
text: AirDAS data, comments catch-field, meaning used record information fit neatly AirDAS framework. instance, users often enter comment indicating recording extra information mola mola sightings. , information recorded systematic way, can still use swfscAirDAS functions determine information. comment indicating whether something recorded likely contain “record” somewhere comment. Thus, can use airdas_comments extract comments, subset comments contain pattern “record”. can extract data ‘systematic’ comments, using airdas_comments_process. function supports codes TURTLE/PHOCOENA data, text string format CARETTA data. Specifically, includes comment.format argument users CARETTA data, allows provide list specifying data recorded, although data must separated delimiter. See comment.format value default CARETTA data. function also default looks codes, e.g. “fb” “cp”, TURTLE/PHOCOENA data; see ?airdas_comments_process details.

what: Southwest Fisheries Science Center Aerial DAS Data Processing
title: Southwest Fisheries Science Center Aerial DAS Data Processing
text: package contains functions designed processing analyzing aerial survey DAS data (AirDAS) generated Southwest Fisheries Science Center using one following programs: PHOCOENA, CARETTA, TURTLE (TURTLEP TURTLE4D). Functionality includes reading AirDAS data data frame, processing data (extracting state condition information AirDAS event), summarizing sighting effort information. Plans future development include: generating tables summarizing information AirDAS file, plotting AirDAS data, generating files needed density estimation. Learn vignette("swfscAirDAS")

title: Southwest Fisheries Science Center Aerial DAS Data Processing

title: Southwest Fisheries Science Center Aerial DAS Data Processing
text: swfscAirDAS accepts AirDAS data several different programs, thus several different formats: PHOCOENA, CARETTA, TURTLE. can download PDFs describing formats following links: PHOCOENA data format PDF CARETTA data format PDF TURTLE data format PDF PDFs also included package; see airdas_format_pdf details. addition, package contains function airdas_check, checks whether provided file adheres expected format provided file type. function designed 1) used data QA/QC performing survey 2) ensure data format meets assumptions made rest functions package. PDF describing format checks included package; can also download PDF

title: Check AirDAS file — airdas_check
text: file filename(s) one AirDAS files file.type character; indicates program used create file. Must one : "turtle", "caretta", "survey", "phocoena" (case sensitive). Default "turtle". Passed airdas_read skip integer: see read_fwf. Default 0.  Passed airdas_read file.character; filename write error log.  text CSV file. Default NULL sp.codes character; filename .dat file read  accepted species codes.  NULL, default (internal) file used.  Default NULL print.transect logical; indicates table  transect numbers x printed using table. Default TRUE

code: y <- system.file("airdas_sample.das", package = "swfscAirDAS") y.proc <- airdas_process(y)  y.eff1 <- airdas_effort(y.proc, method = "equallength", seg.km = 35, num.cores = 1) #> No argument was passed via randpicks.load, and thus new randpicks values will be generated y.eff2 <- airdas_effort(y.proc, method = "section", num.cores = 1)  all.equal(y.eff1, y.eff2) #> [1] TRUE

what: Process comments in AirDAS data — airdas_comments_process
title: Process comments in AirDAS data — airdas_comments_process
text: Extract miscellaneous information recorded AirDAS data comments, .e. comment-data

title: Process comments in AirDAS data — airdas_comments_process
code: airdas_comments_process(x, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame airdas_comments_process(x, ...)  # S3 method for airdas_dfr airdas_comments_process(x, comment.format = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for airdas_df airdas_comments_process(x, comment.format = NULL, ...)

title: Process comments in AirDAS data — airdas_comments_process
text: x airdas_dfr airdas_df object,  data frame can coerced airdas_dfr object ... ignored comment.format list; default NULL.  See 'Using comment.format' section

title: Process comments in AirDAS data — airdas_comments_process
text: x, filtered comments recorded data,    following columns added:  comment_str: full comment string Misc#: number descriptor columns. n columns,        although minimum number two columns Value: Associated count percentage TURTLE/PHOCOENA data flag_check: logical indicating TURTLE/PHOCOENA        comment string longer expected number characters,        thus manually inspected See additional sections context.    comment.format NULL,    output data frame two Misc# columns:    level one descriptor, e.g. "Fish ball" "Jellyfish",    level two descriptor, e.g. s, m, c.    However, comment.format$n say 4, output data frame   columns Misc1, Misc2, Misc3, Misc4. Messages printed either comment.format NULL comment-data identified using comment.format,  x TURTLE/PHOCOENA data TURTLE/PHOCOENA comment-data

title: Process comments in AirDAS data — airdas_comments_process
text: Historically, project-specific miscellaneous data    recorded AirDAS comments using specific formats character codes.    functions identifies extracts data comment text strings.    However, different data types different comment-data formats.    Specifically, TURTLE PHOCOENA comment-data uses identifier codes    signify certain data pattern, comment-data   (usually CARETTA) uses data separated delimiter.

title: Process comments in AirDAS data — airdas_comments_process
text: Current supported data types : fish balls, molas, jellyfish, crab pots.    See AirDAS format PDFs (airdas_format_pdf)    information specific codes formats used   record data. comments converted lower case processing    avoid missing data. different codes contain ():   level one descriptor (e.g. fish ball crab pot),    level two descriptor (e.g. size jellyfish species),    value (count percentage).    Thus, extracted data returned together structure.    output data frame long data, .e. one piece information per line.   instance, comment "fb1s fb1m", output data frame   one line small fish ball one medium fish ball.    See Value section details. Currently function recognizes mola data recorded using    "m1", "m2", "m3" codes (small, medium, large mola, respectively).    Thus, "mola" recognized processed. following codes used level two descriptors:

title: Process comments in AirDAS data — airdas_comments_process
text: comment.format list allows user specify comment-data format.   use argument, data must separated delimiter.   list must contain three named elements: n: single number indicating number elements data comment.       Must equal length type.       comment must contain exactly number sep recognized comment-data sep: single string indicating field separator string (delimiter).       Values within comment separated string.       Currently accepted values ";" "," type: character vector length n indicating data type       data element (column).       values must one : "character", "numeric", "integer". instance, CARETTA data comment.format   list(n = 5, sep = ";", type = c("character", "character", "numeric", "numeric", "character"))

title: airdas_df class — airdas_df-class
text: airdas_df class subclass data.frame,   created provide concise robust way ensure input    downstream AirDAS processing functions, airdas_sight,    adheres certain requirements.   Specifically, objects class airdas_df data frames specific column names classes,   detailed 'Properties airdas_df' section.    addition, airdas_df objects NA values    'Lat' 'Lon', 'DateTime' columns.   Objects class airdas_df created airdas_process    as_airdas_df, intended passed directly   DAS processing functions airdas_sight. Subsetting, say specific date transect number,    otherwise altering object class airdas_df   cause object drop airdas_df class attribute, although note    combining two airdas_df objects using rbind    return object airdas_df class attribute.   object passed DAS processing function airdas_sight,    function try coerce object airdas_df object.

title: Summarize AirDAS effort — airdas_effort
text: Chop AirDAS data effort segments

title: Summarize AirDAS effort — airdas_effort
code: airdas_effort(x, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame airdas_effort(x, ...)  # S3 method for airdas_df airdas_effort(   x,   method = c("condition", "equallength", "section"),   conditions = NULL,   distance.method = c("greatcircle", "lawofcosines", "haversine", "vincenty"),   num.cores = NULL,   angle.min = 12,   bft.max = 5,   ... )

title: Summarize AirDAS effort — airdas_effort
text: x airdas_df object; output airdas_process,  data frame can coerced airdas_df object ... arguments passed chopping function specified using method, seg.km seg.min.km method character; method use chop AirDAS data effort segments Can "condition", "equallength", "section",  partial match thereof (case sensitive) conditions character vector names conditions  include segdata output. values must column names output airdas_process, e.g. 'Bft', 'CCover', etc. default NULL,  case relevant conditions included. method == "condition", also conditions trigger segment chopping change. distance.method character; method use calculate distance lat/lon coordinates. Can "greatcircle", "lawofcosines", "haversine", "vincenty", partial match thereof (case sensitive). Default "greatcircle" num.cores Number CPUs distribute computations. Defaults NULL, uses one fewer number cores reported detectCores Using 1 core likely faster smaller datasets angle.min passed airdas_sight bft.max numeric; maximum Beaufort (column 'Bft')  mark sighting TRUE 'included' (see Details).  Default 5.

title: Summarize AirDAS effort — airdas_effort
text: List three data frames:  segdata: one row every segment, columns information including       unique segment number, event code started associated continuous effort section,        starting ending line segment DAS file (stlin, endlin),       start/end/midpoint coordinates(lat1/lon1, lat2/lon2, mlat/mlon, respectively),       start/end/midpoint date/time segment (DateTime1, DateTime2, mDateTime, respectively;       mDateTime average DateTime1 DateTime2), segment length (dist),       conditions (e.g. Beaufort) sightinfo: details sightings x, including:        unique segment number associated , segment mid points (lat/lon),        'included' column described Details section,       output information described airdas_sight randpicks: see airdas_chop_equallength.        NULL using "condition" method.

title: Summarize AirDAS effort — airdas_effort
text: top-level function chopping processed AirDAS data    modeling segments (henceforth 'segments'), assigning sightings    related information (e.g., weather conditions) segment.    function returns data frames relevant information    effort segments associated sightings ('segdata' 'sightinfo', respectively).    chopping, AirDAS data filtered events (rows) either   'OnEffort' column TRUE 'Event' column "E" "O".    words, data filtered continuous effort sections (henceforth 'effort sections'),    effort sections run "T"/"R" "E"/"O" events (inclusive),    passed chopping function specified using method.    effort events must NA Lat Lon values;    note Lat/Lon values 1 events 'filled ' airdas_process. following chopping methods currently available:    "condition", "equallength", "section".    using "condition" method, effort sections chopped    segments every time condition specified conditions changes,    thereby ensuring conditions consistent across entire segment.   See airdas_chop_condition details method,    including arguments must passed via .... "equallength" method consists   chopping effort sections equal-length segments length seg.km,    weighted average conditions length segment.    See airdas_chop_equallength details method,    including arguments must passed via .... "section" method involves 'chopping' effort continuous effort sections,   .e. continuous effort section single effort segment.   See airdas_chop_section details method. distance lat/lon points subsequent events   calculated using method specified distance.method.   "greatcircle", distance_greatcircle used,   distance used otherwise.   See airdas_sight sightings processed. sightinfo data frame includes column 'included',   used airdas_effort_sight summarizing   number sightings animals selected species.   airdas_effort_sight separate function allow users   personalize 'included' values desired specific analysis.   default, .e. output function, 'included' TRUE :   sighting standard sighting (see airdas_sight)    Beaufort sea state less equal 'btf.max'.

However, sightings included value TRUE   (included column sightinfo) included summaries.   step separate airdas_effort allows users   personalize included values desired analysis.

title: Aerial DAS format requirements — airdas_format_pdf
text: Access save local PDF documents describing data format  different file types supported swfscAirDAS

title: Aerial DAS format requirements — airdas_format_pdf
code: airdas_format_pdf(file, file.type = c("phocoena", "caretta", "turtle"), ...)

title: Aerial DAS format requirements — airdas_format_pdf
text: file character; name file PDF saved file.type character; indicates data format PDF extract. Must one : "turtle", "caretta", "survey", "phocoena" (case sensitive) ... passed file.copy;  might included named argument overwrite

title: Aerial DAS format requirements — airdas_format_pdf
text: output file.copy:  TRUE writing file successful, FALSE otherwise

title: Aerial DAS format requirements — airdas_format_pdf
text: function wrapper function file.copy.    saves PDF document describing specified aerial DAS data    format requirements copying PDF document file PDF files can also manually copied downloaded : PHOCOENA Can copied :        system.file("AirDAS_Format_PHOCOENA.pdf", package = "swfscAirDAS") Can downloaded :        https://github.com/smwoodman/swfscAirDAS/blob/master/inst/AirDAS_Format_PHOCOENA.pdf CARETTA Can copied :        system.file("AirDAS_Format_CARETTA.pdf", package = "swfscAirDAS") Can downloaded :        https://github.com/smwoodman/swfscAirDAS/blob/master/inst/AirDAS_Format_CARETTA.pdf TURTLE Can copied :        system.file("AirDAS_Format_TURTLE.pdf", package = "swfscAirDAS") Can downloaded :        https://github.com/smwoodman/swfscAirDAS/blob/master/inst/AirDAS_Format_TURTLE.pdf

title: Aerial DAS format requirements — airdas_format_pdf
code: if (interactive()) {   airdas_format_pdf(     "AirDAS_Format_TURTLE.pdf", file.type  = "turtle",      overwrite = FALSE   ) }

what: Process aerial survey DAS data — airdas_process
title: Process aerial survey DAS data — airdas_process
text: Process AirDAS data (output airdas_read),    including extracting state condition information AirDAS event

title: Process aerial survey DAS data — airdas_process
code: airdas_process(x, ...)  # S3 method for character airdas_process(x, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame airdas_process(x, ...)  # S3 method for airdas_dfr airdas_process(   x,   days.gap.part = 0.5/24,   days.gap.full = 12/24,   gap.message = FALSE,   reset.transect = TRUE,   trans.upper = FALSE,   ... )

title: Process aerial survey DAS data — airdas_process
text: x object class airdas_dfr object,  object can coerced class airdas_dfr, character (filepath) first passed airdas_read ... passed airdas_read x character. Otherwise ignored days.gap.part numeric length 1;  time gap (days) used identify 'partial reset' performed,  .e. propagated info (weather, observers, etc) reset.  Default 30 minutes; must less equal days.gap.full days.gap.full numeric length 1;  time gap (days) used identify 'full reset; performed,  .e. info (transect number propagated info) reset.  Default 12 hours; must greater days.gap.part gap.message logical; default FALSE. Indicates messages printed detailing row(s)  output data frame partially fully reset reset.transect logical; default TRUE. Indicates propagated info (weather, observers, etc) reset  NA beginning new transect. See Details section trans.upper logical; indicates transect codes  capitalized using toupper. Default FALSE

title: Process aerial survey DAS data — airdas_process
text: airdas_df object, also data frame.   consists input data frame, .e. output airdas_read,   following columns added:  See airdas_format_pdf data columns condition information    extracted form file type.    addition, warnings printed line numbers unexpected event codes

title: Process aerial survey DAS data — airdas_process
text: x character, assumed filepath    first passed airdas_read.    output processed. function handle concatenated airdas_dfr objects multiple file types.    words, AirDAS data must processed concatenated. AirDAS data event-based, meaning events indicate state weather condition changes.   instance, 'W' event indicates one weather conditions    (Beaufort sea state) change, weather conditions    subsequent events next 'W' event.   state/condition: new column created,    state/condition information extracted relevant events,    extracted information propagated appropriate subsequent rows (events).    Thus, row output data frame contains    pertinent state/condition information row. following assumptions/decisions made processing: '#' events (deleted events) removed 'DateTime', 'Lat', 'Lon' information added '1' events applicable Effort determined follows: T/R events turns effort ,        O/E events turn effort .        T/R events effort, O/E events effort.       'EffortDot' column ignored 'HKR' values converted lower case. "Y" values considered "H" values Observer ('ObsL', 'ObsB', 'ObsR', 'Rec') values converted lower case Viewing condition ('VLI', 'VLO', 'VB', 'VRI', 'VRO') values converted lower case Missing values NA rather -1 Normally, T event (indicate starting/resuming transect)   immediately followed VPAW event series, creating TVPAW event series.   reset.transect argument causes conditions set VPAW event series   (Beaufort, viewing conditions, altitude, etc.) reset NA T event

title: Summarize AirDAS data for a continuous effort section — airdas_segdata
text: x airdas_df object,  data frame can coerced airdas_df object. Must contain single continuous effort section AirDAS data;  see Details section ... ignored conditions see airdas_effort, see Details section information segdata.method character; either "avg" "maxdist". "avg" means condition values calculated weighted average distance, "maxdist" means condition values recorded longest distance segment seg.lengths numeric; length modeling segments  x chopped section.id numeric; ID x (current continuous effort section)

title: Summarize AirDAS data for a continuous effort section — airdas_segdata
text: Data frame segdata information described   airdas_effort

title: Summarize AirDAS data for a continuous effort section — airdas_segdata
text: WARNING - call function directly!   exported documentation purposes, intended internal package use . function designed called one airdas_chop_ functions,    e.g. airdas_chop_equallength, thus    users avoid calling .   loops events x, calculating storing relevant   information modeling segment goes.    x continuous effort section, must begin    "T" "R" event end corresponding "E" "O" event. segment, function reports    segment ID, transect code, start/end/mid coordinates (lat/lon),   start/end/mid date/times (DateTime), segment length,    year, month, day, time, observers,    average conditions (specified conditions).   segment ID designated section.id _ index modeling segment.   Thus, section.id 1, segment ID    second segment x "1_2". segdata.method "avg", condition values   calculated weighted average distance.   reported value logical columns (e.g. Haze) percentage   (decimals) segment condition TRUE.   character columns, reported value segment   unique value(s) present segment, NAs omitted,   pasted together via paste(..., collapse = "; ").   segdata.method "maxdist", reported values   , condition, value recorded longest distance   segment (NAs omitted). Transect code, file name, vent code started continuous effort section    also included segdata output.   values (excluding NAs) must consistent across   entire effort section, thus across segments x;   warning printed inconsistencies. bearing destination   used calculate segment start, mid, end points,   method = "vincenty".

title: Aerial DAS sightings — airdas_sight
text: Data frame 1) columns x, excluding 'Data#' columns,   2) columns sighting information extracted 'Data#' columns described .   data frame one row sighting, one row    species sighting multi-species (mixed) sighting. Added sighting information columns:  TurtleSize class character    CARETTA data x, class numeric otherwise.

title: Aerial DAS sightings — airdas_sight
text: AirDAS events contain specific information 'Data#' columns,   information depending event code file type row.   function extracts relevant data sighting events, returns   data frame dedicated columns piece sighting information.    can handle multiple file types x; instance,    x processed PHOCOENA TURTLE data   combined using rbind.    See airdas_format_pdf information expected   events event formats, depending file type. species codes converted lower case using tolower. Abbreviations used column names include: Gs = group size, Sp = species,    Mixed = mixed species (multi-species) sighting.    addition, note multi-species group sizes rounded    nearest whole number using round(, 0) 'sighting standard observer' ('ObsStd') sighting    made ObsL, ObsB, ObsR (data recorder pilot).      'standard sighting' ('SightStd') sighting    made effort, standard observer,    absolute value angle declination    greater equal angle.min.      Resights (Events 's') considered standard events,    thus 'ObsStd' 'SightStd' NA 's' events.

title: Subsetting objects created using swfscAirDAS — subsetting
code: y <- system.file("airdas_sample.das", package = "swfscAirDAS") y.read <- airdas_read(y)  # All return a data frame: class(y.read[1:10, ]) #> [1] "data.frame" class(y.read[, 1:10]) #> [1] "data.frame"  y.df <- y.read y.df[, 1] <- "a" class(y.df) #> [1] "data.frame"  y.df <- y.read y.df$Event <- "a" class(y.df) #> [1] "data.frame"  y.df <- y.read y.df[["Event"]] <- "a" class(y.df) #> [1] "data.frame"

what: Southwest Fisheries Science Center Aerial Survey DAS — swfscAirDAS-package
title: Southwest Fisheries Science Center Aerial Survey DAS — swfscAirDAS-package
text: Process summarize aerial survey DAS data

title: Southwest Fisheries Science Center Aerial Survey DAS — swfscAirDAS-package
text: package contains functions designed processing analyzing  aerial survey DAS data (AirDAS) collected using one following  Southwest Fisheries Science Center (SWFSC) programs:  PHOCOENA, SURVEY, CARETTA, TURTLE (TURTLEP TURTLE 4D). Functionality includes checking AirDAS data data entry errors,  reading AirDAS data data frame, processing data  (extracting state condition information AirDAS event),  summarizing sighting effort information.

title: Southwest Fisheries Science Center Aerial Survey DAS — swfscAirDAS-package
text: Sam Woodman sam.woodman@noaa.gov
